fields.description: Boolean value used to enable enhanced anti-spoofing for facial feature recognition on Windows Hello face authentication.
fields.name: EnhancedAntiSpoofingForFacialFeaturesEnabled

fields.description: Integer value specifies the period (in days) that a PIN can be used before the system requires the user to change it. Valid values are 0 to 730 inclusive. Valid values 0 to 730
fields.name: PinExpirationInDays

fields.description: Possible values of the ConfigurationUsage list.
fields.name: PinLowercaseCharactersUsage

fields.description: Integer value that sets the maximum number of characters allowed for the work PIN. Valid values are 4 to 127 inclusive and greater than or equal to the value set for the minimum PIN. Valid values 4 to 127
fields.name: PinMaximumLength

fields.description: Integer value that sets the minimum number of characters required for the Windows Hello for Business PIN. Valid values are 4 to 127 inclusive and less than or equal to the value set for the maximum PIN. Valid values 4 to 127
fields.name: PinMinimumLength

fields.description: Controls the ability to prevent users from using past PINs. This must be set between 0 and 50, inclusive, and the current PIN of the user is included in that count. If set to 0, previous PINs are not stored. PIN history is not preserved through a PIN reset. Valid values 0 to 50
fields.name: PinPreviousBlockCount

fields.description: Boolean value that enables a user to change their PIN by using the Windows Hello for Business PIN recovery service.
fields.name: PinRecoveryEnabled

fields.description: Possible values of the ConfigurationUsage list.
fields.name: PinSpecialCharactersUsage

fields.description: Possible values of the ConfigurationUsage list.
fields.name: PinUppercaseCharactersUsage

fields.description: Controls whether to require a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) for provisioning Windows Hello for Business. A TPM provides an additional security benefit in that data stored on it cannot be used on other devices. If set to False, all devices can provision Windows Hello for Business even if there is not a usable TPM.
fields.name: SecurityDeviceRequired

fields.description: Controls the use of biometric gestures, such as face and fingerprint, as an alternative to the Windows Hello for Business PIN.  If set to False, biometric gestures are not allowed. Users must still configure a PIN as a backup in case of failures.
fields.name: UnlockWithBiometricsEnabled

fields.description: Boolean value that enables Windows Hello for Business to use certificates to authenticate on-premise resources.
fields.name: UseCertificatesForOnPremisesAuthEnabled

fields.description: Boolean value used to enable the Windows Hello security key as a logon credential.
fields.name: UseSecurityKeyForSignin

fields.description: Boolean value that blocks Windows Hello for Business as a method for signing into Windows.
fields.name: WindowsHelloForBusinessBlocked
